adverbs.description: practically (comparative more practically, superlative most practically)

entries.meaning: In practice; in effect or actuality, though possibly not officially.

examples: He was practically uneducated, barely able to read and write a simple sentence.

entries.meaning: With respect to practices or a practice.
examples: He wasn't very good with words or numbers; he was more of a practically minded person
He was practically educated and lacked theoretical depth.
